node.title: Former minister Adem Somyurek will vote against Andrews government's pandemic laws
node.description: The Andrews government's pandemic laws are in tatters with former minister Adem Somyurek declaring he will vote against the bill in its current form.

node.title: Fugitive couple sentenced to prison over COVID fraud scheme
node.description: Richard Ayvazyan and his wife, Marietta Terabelian, remain at large after the FBI says they removed their electronic tracking bracelets in August.

node.title: Staples Center is getting a new name
node.description: It could be the largest naming rights deal in history — but for many L.A. sports fans, it's a big mistake.

node.title: ‘Prayers for the Stolen’ Review: Coming of Age Among the Poppies
node.description: Tatiana Huezo’s feature film is based on a novel about girls growing up in Mexico in communities terrorized by opium cartels.

node.title: The prosecution’s case against Elizabeth Holmes, the Theranos founder.
node.description: Jurors are being asked to decide whether Ms. Holmes misled investors by withholding crucial information or whether investors simply failed to do their due diligence.

node.title: Where Are Young People Most Optimistic? In Poorer Nations.
node.description: More than half of Americans, young and old, say children today will be less economically successful than their parents, a global survey shows.

node.title: An injured athlete was flown home on a cargo plane because of the Beijing Olympics’ Covid rules.
node.description: A Polish luger, Mateusz Sochowicz, was told that coronavirus restrictions prevented him from boarding a commercial flight for another two weeks.

node.title: What Is a COVID Breakthrough Case? Dancing With the Stars Judge Derek Hough Tests Positive
node.description: The TV personality developed COVID despite being fully vaccinated. Experts say such cases are to be expected and vaccines still work.

node.title: China Says Joe Biden's Taiwan Policy Based on 'Cooked Up' Domestic Law
node.description: China's Foreign Ministry responded Wednesday after President Biden said Taiwan was "independent," and that the U.S. would not change its "one China" policy.

node.title: Nigerian Army Killed Unarmed Protesters, Report Finds
node.description: The incident in October 2020 could be “equated with a massacre,” a government panel said, refuting the army’s claim that soldiers only fired blanks.

node.title: Italian Police Break Up Drug Smuggling Ring Tied to Calabria Mob
node.description: Over 100 people were arrested in Italy as members of a mafia ring that smuggled drugs from Latin America and infiltrated businesses in southern and northern Italy.

node.title: A Border Crisis
node.description: The situation at the Belarus-Poland border is unlike recent immigration crises.

node.title: Over 100 Dinosaur Tracks From 150 Million Years Ago Discovered in Colorado
node.description: The footprints were found at Picket Wire Canyonlands, which is home to the largest dinosaur track site in North America.

node.title: Thousands of Navy Sailors Face Being Discharged Over Vaccine Refusal
node.description: The Navy's deadline for active-duty sailors to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is November 28.

node.title: Coroner finds police not to blame for deaths of teenagers who drowned in Swan River after chase
node.description: WA's coroner delivers a report into the drownings of two boys who were running away from police, describing the actions of the teenagers as "dangerous and very risky" and saying the officers involved acted appropriately.

node.title: Iowa man convicted of killing man, leaving body burning in ditch
node.description: Three other people - Julia Cox, Roy Garner and Cody Johnson - were charged with destroying evidence of the killing.

node.title: U.S. To Sell Area the Size of New Mexico For Offshore Drilling Just 5 Days After COP26
node.description: Louisiana Solicitor General Elizabeth Murrill told Newsweek Biden's administration had "attacked the entire fossil fuel industry" by trying to prevent the sale. But environmental campaigners want Biden to do more.

node.title: Burmese Pythons Beware, Ron DeSantis Is Coming for You
node.description: The Florida governor announced a $3 million fund to rid the Everglades of the invasive species.

node.title: Defense intel agency director on evolving global threats
node.description: On "Intelligence Matters," host Michael Morell speaks with Lt. Gen. Scott Berrier about the Defense Intelligence Agency

node.title: Inflation in Britain climbs to a 10-year high.
node.description: Prices rose 4.2 percent last month from a year earlier, more than double the Bank of England’s target.

node.title: 'Help Us Get Out of Jonestown'
node.description: Congressman Ryan and journalists had been let in to see Jonestown, and the evening had gone well for Jim Jones. But then someone passed a journalist a note.

node.title: What Is Toad Venom? Effects of Psychedelic Mike Tyson Took Explained
node.description: Some studies have shown the use of toad venom may potentially have psychotherapeutic effects. But is the mind-altering drug dangerous?

node.title: Donald Trump Reveals He Lost Billions of Dollars as President
node.description: The former president made the claim during an interview with MyPillow CEO and conspiracy theorist Mike Lindell.

node.title: Highest Death Toll Predicted on the Roads Over Thanksgiving Weekend in 10 Years
node.description: "If this estimate holds true, Thanksgiving 2021 will experience the most deaths since 2007," said the National Safety Council.

node.title: What Young People Say About Mental Health
node.description: Here’s what people ages 15 to 24 from 21 countries said in a new survey.

node.title: Blinken warns of "democratic recession" as he addresses Africa crises
node.description: 3-nation visit is part of a long-delayed mission aimed, at part, in answering China's outreach to the continent, but it comes amid war in Ethiopia and a military takeover in Sudan.

node.title: What Did Romney and Sinema’s Halloween Costumes Really Mean?
node.description: Two senators join together in some deft trolling, and absolutely infuriate a subset of TV viewers.

node.title: He’s Remaking Criminal Justice in L.A. But How Far Is Too Far?
node.description: To keep people out of prison, George Gascón is risking everything: rising violent crime, a staff rebellion and the votes that made him district attorney.

node.title: A Crispy Upgrade for Cheese and Crackers
node.description: An unpretentious bar snack transformed into something sublime.

node.title: One Chaste Marriage, Four Kids, and the Catholic Church
node.description: A son reflects on his parents’ commitment, endorsed by the Catholic church, to cohabit chastely like “brother and sister” to avoid mortal sin.

node.title: The Making of Black Ivy Style
node.description: A new book examines how Black civil rights leaders, jazzmen, artists and writers rewrote the sartorial codes of a largely white elite.

node.title: Newly Published, From Haruki Murakami’s T-Shirts to Sally Hemings
node.description: A selection of books published this week.

node.title: Adele, Music’s Comet, Returns With ‘30.’ How Bright Will It Burn?
node.description: The British powerhouse’s new album will arrive in a vastly changed music business. But she’s proven to be the exception to almost every rule throughout her 13-year career.

node.title: Up, Up and Away: The Trippy Tales Behind ‘Flying Over Sunset’
node.description: How’s this for an unlikely idea for a musical? Three 1950s celebrities, including Cary Grant, experimenting with LSD. Together. It happened, sort of.

node.title: The Two Worlds of Billy Horschel
node.description: He has won the BMW PGA Championship and is now close to winning the European Tour’s Race to Dubai.

node.title: An Indigenous Women’s Softball Team Beats Opponents, and Machismo

node.title: An American May Finally Win the Race to Dubai
node.description: It’s never happened before, and the sport is wondering what it means if a golfer from the United States wins the European championship.

node.title: Race to Dubai Players to Watch
node.description: They are all among the leaders in the Race to Dubai, and a victory in this tournament could put one of them on top.

node.title: How Leather Seats in Luxury SUVs Fuel Amazon Deforestation
node.description: An examination of Brazil’s immense tannery industry shows how hides from illegally deforested ranches can easily reach the global marketplace. In the United States, much of the demand for Brazilian leather comes from automakers.

node.title: 300 Minutes a Week of Moderate Exercise May Help Ward Off Cancer
node.description: More than 46,000 cancers in America each year, or about 3 percent of cases, could be prevented by meeting physical activity guidelines.

node.title: Is It Time to Abandon the Idea of an ‘Asian American’ Identity?
node.description: Two Asian Americans question the term and its value.

node.title: Democrats Shouldn’t Panic. They Should Go Into Shock.

node.title: Investors Hung Their Hats on Peloton and Zoom Last Year. What Now?
node.description: Some “stay-at-home” stocks that were pandemic-era darlings have experienced brutal sell-offs.

node.title: Travel Industry Takes Crucial First Step Toward Combating Climate Change

node.title: What Was Fashion Doing at COP26?
node.description: Trading buzzwords, talking circularity and grappling with the role of clothes in the climate crisis.

node.title: The N.Y. Governor’s Race Is Wide Open, and Democrats Are Rushing In

node.title: Looking for a Stolen Idol? Visit the Museum of the Manhattan D.A.
node.description: Investigators have seized so many looted artifacts — more than 3,000 — that storing and caring for them until they can be returned is now a full-time job.

node.title: He Was a Boxer and Married to the Mob. He Wasn’t Prepared for Guardianship.
node.description: Marvin Stein lived an eventful and prosperous life.  But a battle among his family over his fortune broke out in his 88th year, and he suddenly found himself powerless to fight for himself.

node.title: The U.S. aims to lift Covid vaccine manufacturing to create a billion doses a year.
node.description: The multibillion-dollar plan is intended to address immediate needs both overseas and domestically, and to improve preparations for future pandemics.

node.title: How a Cure for Gerrymandering Left U.S. Politics Ailing in New Ways
node.description: Independent commissions to oversee the redrawing of electoral maps were thought to be the solution to an age-old problem. Instead, they have become bogged down in political trench warfare.

node.title: From Electric Bikes to ‘Tree Equity,’ Biden’s Social Policy Bill Funds Niche Items
node.description: The Build Back Better Act’s marquee provisions have been the focus, but Democrats have swept dozens of obscure measures and special interest breaks into the $1.85 trillion bill.

node.title: John Cornyn Warns Taiwan Is 'First Domino' in China's Quest for Global Dominance

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Brother 'Grateful' For Donald Trump's Well Wishes

node.title: Chris Christie Says He's 'Not Really' Aware of What Tucker Carlson Does

node.title: They've got all the gear and no idea, but for 'two cartons of beer' novice boaties can have a safer summer

node.title: New Delhi shuts coal-fired plants as it battles toxic air pollution

node.title: Japanese experts craft 'super clone' of Afghan mural destroyed by the Taliban
node.description: Japanese researchers recreate a seventh-century Afghan mural destroyed by the Taliban, using a mix of traditional and digital techniques that they hope will salvage the work's "spirit" for future generations.

node.title: 'My job was to stay alive': Gold Coast good Samaritan survives being stabbed in the chest
node.description: James Fletcher, 40, recounts going to the aid of his elderly neighbour in Palm Beach on Queensland's Gold Coast and being stabbed in the chest area, with the blade somehow missing all his vital organs.

node.title: Excitement, anxiety in Northland as Auckland border set to reopen

node.title: When Is the November 2021 Full Moon, Why Is It Called the Beaver Moon?

node.title: Staples Center Renaming to Crypto Arena Leaves Fans Outraged: 'This Feels Gross'

node.title: Wind gust of almost 100kph recorded as severe storms hit parts of central and south-east Queensland
node.description: Severe storms with large hail and damaging winds sweep through central and south-east Queensland.

node.title: Māori Party wants government mandates abolished

node.title: Gastro outbreak sends Coffin Bay oyster region into trading freeze

node.title: Pfizer to allow developing nations to make its treatment pill
